Ponsonby Road shooting: Man shot dead, local leaders ‘shocked and saddened’, shooting scene blessed https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ponsonby-road-shooting-man-shot-dead-local-leaders-shocked-and-saddened-top-cop-to-front-media/GV7PXQ6Z7ZHVNNPJRO22Q42SWM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ponsonby-road-shooting-man-shot-dead-local-leaders-shocked-and-saddened-top-cop-to-front-media/GV7PXQ6Z7ZHVNNPJRO22Q42SWM/ Rachel Maher, George Block'This violence is shocking and it has no place here.' Scene blessed as hunt continues. Mon, 06 May 2024 06:10:13 +0000 Police are hunting for this man in relation to the fatal shooting in Ponsonby Rd on Sunday night.
Waipā District Council turns off Facebook comments citing ‘nasty’ abuse https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/waipa-district-council-turns-off-facebook-comments-citing-nasty-abuse/7LS6SHYDUFEIJIGUXQ5MFA3U6Y/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/waipa-district-council-turns-off-facebook-comments-citing-nasty-abuse/7LS6SHYDUFEIJIGUXQ5MFA3U6Y/ Maryana GarciaMeanwhile, Hamilton City Council reports rise in false information on social media. Mon, 06 May 2024 05:43:49 +0000 Waipā District Council has turned off comments on information-only posts on its Facebook page, starting this month.
